SENT.plain: A patient with cerebral fat embolism was followed by computed tomography (CT)
For the first few days after injury, CT revealed no abnormality
About a week later, multiple low density areas appeared in the white matter of the frontal region
They disappeared within the subsequent 2 weeks while subdural effusions developed in the fronto-parieto-temporal regions
As neurologic recovery progressed, the subdural effusions gradually diminished and cerebral atrophy was seen
